channel.title: +MT on देवेषु विश्वासटिप्पन्यः
channel.description: Recent content in +MT on देवेषु विश्वासटिप्पन्यः

item.title: Heracles and IIr
item.description:
Source: TW

This image of Herakles was brought from placed in a temple of Apollo ~151 CE. It has a remarkable bilingual inscription in Greek & Parthian dialect of the Iranian language. There Heracles is identified with the Iranic god verethraghna & Apollon with tishtrya. It shows that between Greek & Iranic branches of the IE religion the homologies could be more or less correctly sorted out with Herakles being placed in his ancestral indra-class & Apollo in the rudra-class. This identification is also seen in the statues produced by the Greco-Iranic king Antiochus.

item.title: Herakles deeds
item.description:
The earthly projection of the indrian archetype – the hero Herakles – fighting the tricephalic Geryon; in the H world there is the daiva original of the same myth in the form of the killing of trishiras tvAShTra as well as its earthly projection in the form of rAma aikShvAkava

Herakles (left) seizing the dog of the netherworld Kerberos (note 2 headed here).

Cleaned up the Augean stables.

Ascent to Olympos
